intro: Peucedanum hystrix, commonly known as the fringed cow-wheat, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and often umbrella-shaped inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the flowers are small and white or greenish in color. Peucedanum hystrix is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
